data_table.description: Vertebral Fractures Semi-Quantitative Data, Original Cohort Exams 10, 14, and 22. Dataset t_xrbonefxv_1993_0_0554s contains sq grades at 13 vertebral levels (t4-t12, l1-l4) for 705 persons in Framingham Original Cohort who had x-rays at Exam 10/Exam 14 (baseline) and Exam 22 (follow-up). Specifically, baseline lateral lumbar spine radiographs were obtained in 1967-1969 (Exam 10) and baseline lateral chest radiographs were obtained in 1975-77 (Exam 14). At follow-up, lumbar and thoracic radiographs were repeated in 1992-1993 (Exam 22).

variable.name: OLDT4
variable.description: Vertebral Thoracic Level 4 Reading for Baseline X-ray
variable.value: No Fracture
Semi-quantitative grade 1 (mild fracture: 20-25% reduction in any one vertebral height)
Semi-quantitative grade 2 (moderate fracture: 25-40% reduction in any one vertebral height)
Semi-quantitative grade 3 (severe fracture: > 40% reduction in any one vertebral height)
Not readable or x-ray not available

Semi-quantitative grade 2 (moderate fracture: 25-40% reduction in any one vertebral height)
Semi-quantitative grade 3 (severe fracture: > 40% reduction in any one vertebral height)
Not readable or x-ray not available
